en: The mother will not be at ease until she hears of her son's safe arrival.
ko: 아들이 무사히 도착했다는 소식을 듣기 전까지는 엄마 마음이 편치 않을 거야.

en: The mother folded her baby in her arms.
The mother clasped her baby to her breast.
A mother tends to hold her baby on the left.
ko: 엄마들은 보통 아기를 왼쪽에 안는 편이야.

en: The mother laid her baby on the bed.
The mother is dancing her baby on her knee.
ko: 엄마가 무릎 위에서 아기를 둥둥 태워주며 놀아주고 있어.

en: The mother kissed her baby.
The mother takes pride in her daughter's typing skill.
ko: 엄마는 딸의 타이핑 실력을 아주 자랑스러워해.

en: Mother will show off her children.
ko: 엄마는 자식들 자랑을 엄청 하실 거야.

en: The mother is leading her child by the hand.
ko: 엄마가 아이 손을 잡고 이끌고 있어.

en: A mother is responsible for the conduct of her children.
ko: 엄마는 아이들의 행동에 대해 책임이 있어.

en: The mother put the children to bed.
The mother told the children to be quiet.
A mother must protect her child's teeth from decay.
ko: 엄마는 아이 치아가 썩지 않게 잘 관리해줘야 해.

en: His mother was a school teacher.
The mother was quieting her crying baby.
ko: 엄마는 울고 있는 아기를 달래고 있었어.

en: The mother took her child in her arms.
Mothers often pamper their children.
His mother sat up all night waiting for her son.
ko: 어머니는 아들을 기다리느라 밤을 꼬박 새우셨어.

en: The mother lay beside her baby on the bed.
The mother was practically worn out.
Tom's mother worries about his cough.
ko: 톰의 엄마는 톰이 기침하는 걸 걱정해.

en: Tom's mother is worried about his cough.
ko: 톰의 엄마는 톰의 기침 때문에 걱정하고 있어.

en: The mother was shocked and was at once all sympathy.
The mother hugged the child to her bosom.
Mother bought two bottles of orange juice.
ko: 엄마가 오렌지 주스 두 병을 샀어.

en: The mother greatly missed her daughter, who was away at college.
ko: 엄마는 대학 때문에 떨어져 있는 딸을 너무 보고 싶어 했어.

en: The mother missed her daughter who was away at college.
ko: 엄마는 대학에 가 있는 딸을 그리워했어.

en: We were shocked by the intensity of our mother's anger.
ko: 우리는 엄마가 너무 화가 나셔서 깜짝 놀랐어.

en: A mother's advice would outweigh a friend's.
ko: 엄마의 조언은 친구의 조언보다 훨씬 더 비중이 있어.

en: She inherited her mother's blue eyes.
The mother's voice fetched her child.
The mother elephant bathes her baby in the river.
ko: 엄마 코끼리가 강에서 아기 코끼리를 씻겨주고 있어.

en: He could not but cry, when he heard about his mother's death.
ko: 그는 어머니가 돌아가셨다는 소식을 듣고 울 수밖에 없었어.

en: Her mother's death was a blow to the little girl.
ko: 엄마의 죽음은 그 어린 소녀에게 큰 충격이었어.

en: It is sad to have to part with my mother's old furniture.
ko: 엄마의 오래된 가구들을 처분해야 한다니 너무 슬퍼.

en: Despair was written on the mother's face.
Thanks to my mother's help, I was able to buy a mountain bike.
ko: 엄마가 도와준 덕분에 산악 자전거를 살 수 있었어.

en: Mothers should keep their children from playing in the streets.
ko: 엄마들은 아이들이 길거리에서 놀지 못하게 해야 해.

en: When her mother came, she pretended to be studying.
The girl whose mother is ill is absent today.
ko: 어머니가 편찮으신 그 여자애는 오늘 결석했어.

en: There are many children whose mothers go out to work.
ko: 일하러 나가는 엄마를 둔 아이들이 요즘 참 많아.

en: She wished her mother would not be mad at her.
ko: 걔는 엄마가 자기한테 화내지 않았으면 좋겠다고 생각했어.

en: His mother was right.
Her mother knocked on the door.
Just because a mother happens to be beautiful it does not necessarily follow that her daughter will grow up to be the same.
ko: 엄마가 예쁘다고 해서 딸도 꼭 예쁘게 자라는 법은 아니야.

en: With his mother out of the way, Duke was able to proceed with his plan to embezzle the money from the company.
ko: 어머니라는 장애물이 없어지자, 듀크는 회사 돈을 횡령하려던 계획을 실행에 옮길 수 있었어.

en: His mother is in attendance on him.
His mother is taking care of him.
Mother and child are both doing well.
You cannot learn too much about your own language.
ko: 자기 나라 말은 아무리 배워도 끝이 없어요.

en: My maternal grandmother persists in wearing that old-fashioned dress.
ko: 우리 외할머니는 그 촌스러운 옷을 계속 입겠다고 고집하세요.
